WorkItem.ClosedComment: No longer a known issue in 2.3.14.
WorkItem.Description:
First of all, I love your product and use ist a lot.
If you look at my char (xml File attached) with the 2.2.4 Version of your tool at the slot relative stat value, you can't find a value for haste. 
Also the value of spirit of 1.16 seems to high compared to spell power 0,96 DPS. At least I can't see reasons why spellpower is less valuable than spirit.
Â 
Greetings
   MeisterLi, Rat von Dalaran, Germany
WorkItem.Summary: [Warlock] Haste is missing in Relative Stat Values

Comments.Message:
We'll have a look at it. We have had this problem in older versions but I think the problem should have been fixed now. Meh.
Don't have time to check your xml now, will do so later, but if you have the imp selected, it might help to dismiss that.

As with the other issue you reported I can't seem to open your xml file, even with a fresh install of 2.2.4.
I'll try it again from home where I've got a proper internet connection.

Look at my word document.
The problem is connected with my cast-rotation. It doesn't happen in Version 2.2.2 but in 2.2.3 and 2.2.4.

Thanks
   MeisterLi

It's something to do with a calculation related to Glyph of Conflagrate. Haste is massively undervalued when you selected Glyph of Conflagrate and have Conflagrate somewhere in your cast rotation. I've spent quite a long time trying to root out exactly what's going wrong but my knowledge of the inner workings of Rawr is a bit too limited.

That's already a big help Robmoss2k, thanks :) We already noticed some stuff in the destro-tree was off still (since my main spec has always been affliction, we usually start working at that tree first), but this will help us where to look.

I've changed a massive amount of stuff in the destro tree code locally here, but at the moment I don't know whether it's all correct or not, so I don't want to commit any of it. Clue number one though - conflagrate hits for 12 seconds, i.e. 4 ticks, of immolate and is affected by the usual damage modifiers, not for 15 ticks unadjusted :-P

And I got half way through that comment and idly clicked Add Comment. Ahem. Anyway, I think it's to do with when you change the list of events on the fly, something seems to go wrong when you do that.
